item.field_captions: The Derm on RheumNow podcast is a collection of Citations and Content curated for dermatologists – addressing Psoriasis, PsA, CLE, vasculitis, HS, other CTD skin disorders. dermatology drugs, biiologics, JAKs - their use, efficacy and side effects. Features Dr. Jack Cush, Editor at RheumNow.com. SHOW NOTES Retrospective study of 39 pts w/ MDA5 + DM-ILD Rx w baricitinib. 31 (79.5%) had improvement in Gottron’s, heliotrope, dyspnea, HRCT score, ferritin, LDH, steroid dose & 6 mo survival (87% vs. 70%, p = 0.047). https://t.co/RCTbBsCkeV Pulse Steroids and Mycophenolate in Juvenile Dermatomyositis JAMA Dermatology has published a pilot study demonstrating the safety and efficacy of intermittent intravenous methylprednisolone pulse (IVMP) therapy plus mycophenolate in 28 patients with JDM. https://t.co/i2HBycbWY9 Myelodysplastic & chr myelomonocytic leukemia pts rarely get lupus. Review of 19 w/ SLE & 5 w/ CLE; these were older (65 yrs), more male (15M/9F), w/ less renal [10%] & articular [36%] Dz w/ less dsDNA [32%]. Thought to be clonal inflammatory, & not autoinflammatory, process. https://t.co/EAvkJm6GQs Serious infections w/ adalimumab. Marketscan MarketScan claims study (1/17-12/20) of ADA Rx in Hidradenitis Supprativa (n 1650) or psoriasis(8699). Risk of SIE & hospitalization greater w/ HS (HR 1.53); esp for sepsis & GU infxnhttps://t.co/2qa7O2v6fm&nbsp;No risk of MACE seen w/ initiation of IL-17(R)A inhib. French study of 34 241 ipts Rx IL-17(R)Ai and 381 MACEs. MACE risk was not elevated (OR, 1.25 [95% CI, 0.75-2.08] vs TNF-α inhibitors. https://t.co/WcjgRhr8mj Genetic Risks and Severe Cutaneous Reactions to Allopurinol A matched cohort study shows that HLA-B*58:01 and HLA-A*34:02 are strongly associated with allopurinol-induced severe cutaneous adverse reactions (SCARs), these alleles were absent in more than one-third of those https://t.co/NLpHVhr9Ww Western Australia study of 1854 SLE pts (median 40 yrs old). Interstitial lung disease was seen in in 3.8% of SLE, 26 fold more than controls. Risk factors for ILD included older age, smoking and serositis. SLE-ILD pts had higher mortality rates (MR 52.0, CI 37.0–71.1). 25-Hydroxyvitamin D levels and Lupus Outcomes Lupus patients entering a prospective cohort study with low vitamin D levels faced doubled all-cause mortality risk and tripled risk for major cardiovascular events during follow-up averaging 6 years, researchers said. https://t.co/CYwVy7ls7y ACR2025 Non-Renal Lupus Guidelines – from ACR Convergence 2025 10. "900,000 vs 9 It takes about 900,000 minutes to become a board-certified dermatologist. At that point, you might be very skilled and well-informed. It takes less than nine minutes to make your patient feel seen, understood and reassured. If you skip the 9 minutes, you wasted the 900,000" https://t.co/o7BaWjS4HB
item.title: DERM on RheumNow (November 2025)
Vitamin D and Lupus Outcomes (11.21.2025)

item.field_captions: A focused conversation on the latest in SpA from emerging data and treatment strategies to real-world challenges in diagnosis and management. Abstracts discussed: 1434 (Safety of Prescription NSAIDs in Adults with IBD: Data from a Large Administrative Claims Cohort); 0854: (The Assessments in Spondyloarthritis International Society (ASAS) and Spondyloarthritis Research and Treatment Network (SPARTAN) Revised Classification Criteria for Axial Spondyloarthritis: Development and Validation in the Classification of Axial SpA Inception Cohort Study); LB09 (Rotation or Change of Biologic After TNF blocker treatment failure for axial Spondyloarthritis); 1444 (Real-world comparative effectiveness of tofacitinib, tumor necrosis factor inhibitors, and interleukin-17 inhibitors among patients with axial spondyloarthritis); 1435 (Impact of Treatment With Upadacitinib on Non-Nociceptive Pain and Its Relevance for the Presence of Residual Symptoms in Axial Spondyloarthritis: Results from a Multicountry Observational Study); and 0886 (A First-in-Class Biologic Selectively Targeting HLA-B27-Reactive T Cells in Ankylosing Spondylitis)

item.field_captions: DERM on RheumNow PODCAST (October 2025)Skin important Citations and Content curated for dermatologists – addressing Psoriasis, PsA, CLE, vasculitis, HS, other CTD skin disorders. dermatology drugs, biiologics, JAKs - their use, efficacy and side effects. Features Dr. Jack Cush, Editor at RheumNow.com.SHOW NOTESSkin Biopsies to Predict Scleroderma Outcomes?Fibromyalgia in PsO & PsA is linked to greater treatment complexity and shorter biologic therapy survival. Retro matched 1:4 cohort study 61K PsO& 244K controls. FM prevalence 3.3% (OR 1.45). In PsA w/ FM, req more biologics w/ decr biologic survival (6 vs 10yrs) w/ incr switching (HR 1.82) https://buff.ly/TCc6Kc8Guselkumab FDA Approved for Pediatric Psoriasis and Psoriatic Arthritis  https://rheumnow.com/news/guselkumab-fda-approved-pediatric-psoriasis-and-psoriatic-arthritis   Sonelokimab (SLK) is a nanobody that inhibits IL-17 A&F. Phase 2 ARGO trial 207 active PsA pts Rx w/ SLK 120-mg or 60-mg q4wks or PBO or adalimumab. ACR50 at wk 12 was 60-mg WI=46%; 120-mg WI=46%; PBO 20%. PASI90: 60mg 77% vs 120mg 59% vs PBO 15% https://t.co/ra0NqvUEru https://t.co/FXT6kkXUzHTurkish study of 799 psoriasis pts - 30% had concurrent onset PsO & PsA & in 70% there was a long transition time (~13 yrs) from PsO-to-PsA. Factors assoc w/ prolonged interval included Depression, fatigue, scalp PsO(OR 7), nail PsO (3.2), +Fhx & enthesitis ever (OR 2) https://t.co/wqtSbeQ2vzMediterranean Diet Efficacy in PsoriasisGender Complexities in Psoriatic Arthritis Treatment Outcomes
item.title: DERM on RheumNow (October 2025)

item.field_captions:
Dr. Jack Cush discusses the 2023 EULAR/PReS Guidelines for the management of systemic JIA and Adult-onset Still's disease, presented at EULAR 2023 on Saturday June 3, 2023 in Milan.
This includes a comparison to the ACR 2021 Recommendations on systemic JIA published last year.
item.title: 2023 EULAR/PReS Recommendations on Still's disease

item.field_captions:
Dr. Jack Cush reviews the following research presented at EULAR 2023 in Milan
 AB1484 (2023) G. Fontana, et al. ADULT-ONSET STILL’S DISEASE AND SYSTEMIC JUVENILE IDIOPATHIC ARTHRITIS: PREDICTORS OF DRUG-FREE REMISSION IN A MONOCENTRIC COHORT OP0257 (2023) N. Farina, et al. CANAKINUMAB IN THE TREATMENT OF ADULT-ONSET STILL’S DISEASE: LONG TERM DATA FROM A MONOCENTRIC COHORT AB1503 (2023) I. DI Cola1, F. Ursini2,3, R. Giacomelli4, P. Cipriani1, P. Ruscitti. THE IMPACT OF OBESITY ON CLINICAL COURSE AND BIOLOGIC DMARD FAILURE IN PATIENTS WITH ADULT ONSET STILL’S DISEASE OP0034 (2023) D. Foell, et al. A NOVEL SERUM CALPROTECTIN (MRP8/14) PARTICLE ENHANCED IMMUNO-TURBIDIMETRIC ASSAY (SCAL TURBO) HELPS TO DIFFERENTIATE SJIA FROM OTHER DISEASES IN ROUTINE CLINICAL LABORATORY SETTINGS AB1307 (2023) S. Bindoli, et al. ANALYSIS OF ANTI-SARS-CoV-2 S-RBD IGG ANTIBODY LEVELS IN A COHORT OF PATIENTS RECEIVING IL-1 INHIBITORS POS0277 (2023) C. Bracaglia, et al. SYSTEMIC JUVENILE IDIOPATHIC ARTHRITIS ASSOCIATED LUNG DISEASE IN EUROPE
item.title: Still's Disease Abstracts at EULAR 2023

item.field_captions:
RheumNow's SLE faculty convene to discuss highlight lupus abstracts from EULAR 2023, including:
Discussants:
Dr. Jack Cush, executive editor, RheumNow, Dallas, TX
Dr. Janet Pope, London, Canada
Dr. Bella Mehta, New York
Dr. Yuz Yusof, Leeds, UK
Topics include:
1. POS0170 - All cause mortality in SLE
2. OP0139 Upadacitinib (+/- BTK inhibitor) in SLE
3. Baricitinib in SLE Nephritis
4. POS0586 - Urinary CD163 in Lupus
5. OP0226 LLDAS & Remission in Lupus
6. OP0141 CAR-T Update in SLE
7. POS0120 Ianalumab in SLE
 
Dr. Jack Cush, executive editor, RheumNow, Dallas Dr. Janet Pope, London, Canada Dr. Bella Mehta, New York Dr. Yuz Yusof, Leeds, UK
item.title: SLE Panel Review - EULAR 2023

item.field_captions:
Dr. Eric Ruderman gives an update on new updated EULAR 2023 psoriatic arthritis guidelines

item.title: Psoriatic Arthritis - EULAR 2023 Guidelines (updated)

item.field_captions:
Discussants: Dr. Antoni Chan, Dr. Jonathan Kay, Dr. David Liew, Dr. Jack Cush (moderator)
RheumNow's RA faculty convene to discuss highlight RA abstracts from EULAR 2023, including: 1. TLL-018 vs Tofacitinib in RA 2. Recombinant Zoster vaccination in RA patients on MTX and updacitinib 3. APIPPRA study - ABA vs. PBO in Preclinical RA 4. Continued reliance on Prednisone in RA - POS0319 5. RABBIT Registry: Mortality Risks in RA with ILD 6. Male fertility and MTX use 7. JAK- POT study and CV risk with JAK, TNF or other MOA inhibitors
item.title: RA Panel Discussion from EULAR 2023

This week's Tuesday Night Rheumatology featured a panel discussion on work-life balance issues. 
Straddling career and family obligations can be challenging at all stages of your career and family life. Our panelists discussed the challenges they have faced, provided advice and strategies for managing competing priorities and obligations, and answered attendee questions.

item.field_captions:
61yoWM with bilateral pain/swelling in DIPs. Labs normal, seronegative and Xrays shows evidence of DIP erosive OA.
But what works in EOA?
New Data from Abstract #L05 - Wittoek R, et al. Effect of Denosumab on Structure Modification in Erosive Hand Osteoarthritis: Results of a 48-Week, Monocentric, Randomized, Placebo-controlled, Double-blind Phase 2 Study and Open Label Extension Phase

item.field_captions:
Which myositis patients should you worry and screen for cancer?
An ACR presentation presents a new stratified approach and 18 recommendations for your myositis patients.  Presented by A Oldroyd, et al.     Cancer Screening Recommendations for Patients with Idiopathic Inflammatory Myopathy  https://buff.ly/3UBvPz6

item.field_captions:
New-onset systemic JIA - how will you treat?

item.field_captions:
Dr. Eric Dein interviews Professor Zeide and Dr. Jason Liebowitz about a lively ACR21 talk called, "The Gift of Gab," which guided attendees on how to improve their communications. The acronym RHEUM stands for:
R: Remember your purpose H: Have knowledge about your audience E: Engage your audience U: Unlimited practice M: Make it memorable
item.title: The Gift of Gab: "RHEUM"

item.field_captions:
Dr. Jack Cush is joined by rheumatology colleagues to discuss impressions and impact of the 9/1/21 FDA Drug Safety Communication to physicians regarding new label changes, adding new (Boxed) Warnings for cardiovascular and cancer risks with the use of JAK inhibitors (tofacitinib, baricitinib, upadacitinib) in inflammatory arthritis patients.
The Video discussion includes Drs. Kathryn Dao (Dallas), Rachel Tate (Palm Beach), William Shergy (Huntsville), Jeffrey Sparks (Boston), and Jack Cush (Dallas).
Author Disclosures 
Jack Cush, MD: Advisor/Consultant: Abbvie, Novartis, Amgen, BMS. (Investigator on Pfizer 1133 trial) Rachel Tate, MD: Speakers bureau for Abbvie Kathryn Dao, MD: Nothing to disclose Jeffrey Sparks, MD: research support from Bristol-Myers Squibb and consultancy for AbbVie, Bristol-Myers Squibb, Gilead, Inova Diagnostics, Janssen, Optum, and Pfizer. William Shergy, MD:  Speaker for Amgen, Pfizer, and AbbVie; Clinical trials with AbbVie, Amgen, BMS, Gilead, and Pfizer,
item.title: Rheumatologists Speak Out on New FDA JAK inhibitor Boxed Warnings
RheumNow Podcast – JAK Inhibitor Warnings from the FDA (9.3.2021)
Expert Panel: Initial Views on FDA Warnings for JAK Inhibitors
RheumNow Podcast – COVID Marching Amidst the Madness (8.27.2021)
RheumNow Podcast – Driving in Pain (8.20.2021)
RheumNow Podcast – Booster Shots for COVID (8.13.2021)
RheumNow Podcast – Saphnelo (Anifrolumab) Approved for Lupus (8.6.2021)
RheumNow Podcast – Psoriatic Arthritis Without Psoriasis (7.30.2021)
